name: The Yankees of New York Quiz for Experts |       MLB Teams

questions.text: What was Lou Gehrig's batting average in 1939, the last season of his career?
questions.explanation:
.143

	Gehrig won two MVP titles in his career, one in 1927, and one in 1936. During his 17 year career (1923-1939), he only played for the Yankees.

	Mantle hit 536 career HR. Mantle spent all of his 18 year career with the Yankees (1951-1968).

questions.text: On what date was Yankee Stadium opened?
questions.explanation:
April 18, 1923.

	The Yankees won the game against the Red Sox, 4-1. Before they played in Yankee Stadium, they played in the Polo Grounds.

questions.text: On what date did George Steinbrenner buy the Yankees?
questions.explanation:
January 3, 1973.

	Steinbrenner bought the Yankees from CBS.

questions.text: Against what team did David Wells pitch a perfect game?
questions.explanation:
Twins.

	The game was at Yankee Stadium, on May 17th, 1998. The Yankees won 4-0.

questions.text: What is Bernie Williams' career batting average on opening day 2002?
questions.explanation:
.305

	Williams has won 4 Gold Gloves (1997-2000), and one batting title. He joined the Yankees in 1991.

questions.text: Who was the first Yankee to have a 30 HR and 30 SB season?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Bonds & Bonds.

	In his only season with the Yankees (1975), Bonds hit 32 HR and stole 30 bases. Bonds is the father of Barry Bonds.

questions.text: When the Yankees retired Don Mattingly's number 23 in 1998, it was the ____ different number that the Yankees retired?
questions.explanation:
14th.

	The 14 retired numbers were: #1 Billy Martin. #3 Babe Ruth. #4 Lou Gehrig. #5 Joe DiMaggio. #7 Mickey Mantle. #8 Bill Dickey and Yogi Berra. #9 Roger Maris. #10 Phil Rizzuto. #15 Thurman Munson. #16 Whitey Ford. #23 Don Mattingly. #32 Elston Howard. #37 Casey Stengel. #44 Reggie Jackson.

questions.text: In Yankee Stadium, what is the distance from home plate to the right field foul pole?
questions.explanation:
314.

	The distance to left field is 318.

questions.text: What was Derek Jeter's highest season batting average during the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
.349

	Jeter hit .349 in 1999. Jeter also lead the majors in hits in 1999, with 219.

questions.text: Who was known as "The Yankee Clipper"?
questions.explanation:
Joe DiMaggio.

	DiMaggio was married to Marilyn Monroe. In his 13 year career (1936-42 and 1946-51), he only played for the Yankees.

questions.text: What was the original name of the New York Yankees?
questions.explanation:
Baltimore Orioles.

	The Baltimore Orioles (1901-1902) then NY Highlanders (1903-1912) and then NY Yankees from 1913.

questions.text: Who was the first manager of the franchise?
questions.explanation:
John McGraw & McGraw.

	At the end of the 1902 he left to manage the New York Giants. He was elected to the Fall of Fame in 1937.

questions.text: Who was the first Yankee to wear number 1?
questions.explanation:
Earle Combs & Combs.

	He wore it because he was the leadoff man. Earle "The Kentucky Colonel" Combs, only played for the Yankees (1924-1935).

questions.text: What was Elston Howard's highest batting average in a season?
questions.explanation:
.348

	His career batting average is .274. he played 13 of his 14 year career with the Yankees.  The last team of his career was the Red Sox.
